messages: 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (01:15): wow, that quit message tripped me up
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (01:15): one of my friend's names is burton
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:24): does he work at lockheed martin?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (01:25): still at university
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:25): bummer
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:25): wouldn't it have been awesome if i had been right though
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:26): is it <details open="true"> or <details open="open">?
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:27): and does <details open="false"> or <details open="closed"> work?
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:28): attribute minimization isn't allowed in XHTML, and HTML5 is aiming for an XHTML implementation, so this is important
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:28): it's <details open=""> and <details>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:29): (<details open="open"> is also allowed. the actual value has no effect, only the presence or absence of the attribute matters.)
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:30): thanks. and would the javascript interface include setAttribute("open", "anythinggoeshere")?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:30): anything will work, but only "" and "open" are allowed for the second argument (they both open the element)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:30): see http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#the-details-element
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:30): in particular, notice it says that "The open content attribute is a boolean attribute."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:31): and then see http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#boolean-attribute
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:31): ah, I see, that "boolean attribute" part confused me at first
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:31): once browsers implement <details>, there'll also be a .open DOM attribute
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:31): the section, or the term?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:31): ah
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:31): I missed the explaination
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:31): always follow hyperlinks to read the definitions :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:32): the terms in html5 are not always what they appear (usually due to a lack of more appropriate terms)
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:32): that page always make Opera run so slow while loading so sometimes I'm too lazy to open it
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:33): lol, I know , it's bad
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:33): is there a sectioned version of the spec?
84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270 (01:34): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:34): http://whatwg.org/html5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:34): ^ multipage version
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:34): it says so right at the top of the document :-)
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:38): coolness, I made a simple style rule that takes care of open/closed
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:39): it excludes IE6 and 7 tho AFAIK
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:39): uses the :before pseudo-element
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:43): say, should the contents of <details> (except for the triangle) be a bit indented?
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:44): The details
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:45): --The details
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:45): something like that?
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:45): where the content lines up with the legend text, past the triangle
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:46): well, it's probably going to be the choice of the UA developers, but I mean, like a recommended style
06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c (01:52): yikes, Firefox thinks the whole page down from the <legend> is wrapped in a <fieldset> since there's a <legend> there
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:54): 06b151deb3234ed28a1a336408f4e87c: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/rendering.html#the-details-element-0
